title: I can't learn from book. How do I learn math? - Quora

response.answer_text: I'm not really sure I believe that you can't learn from a book.  But let's set that aside for the moment. You can try videos.  Khan Academy, for example, has a ton of "bite sized" instructional videos.  (How do you know what videos to watch?  Maybe track the table of contents of a book.) You might also consider live, human interaction.  An obvious variation of this is to just take a class, assuming your college offers them at an appropriate level.  (Or even if you don't register for the class, consider just sitting in.)  A typical class at this level involves the professor introducing a concept and then working a bunch of examples.  So, presto... no need to read the book. If you don't feel like doing that, consider getting a tutor.  He or she will probably do the same thing, but perhaps in a more interactive/tailored environment.
